content:
[Issue] droid exec cannot use custom droids

Reproduction: add a custom droid to `<repo>/.factory/droids/`

author: tofunori
content:
[Issue] [Bug] Droid CLI duplicates infinitely when opening new tab in PowerShell (Windows)

## Description
When opening a new tab in PowerShell on Windows, the droid CLI process starts duplicating infinitely, creating multiple "Thinking..." processes that cannot be stopped.

## Steps to Reproduce
1. Open PowerShell on Windows
2. Run the droid CLI
3. Open a new PowerShell tab
4. Observe the infinite duplication

## Expected Behavior
Opening a new tab should not trigger any duplication or unexpected behavior in the droid CLI.

## Actual Behavior
The droid CLI starts creating infinite "Th

author: britannio
content:
[Issue] `droid exec --output-format stream-json` is missing a matching id in tool_result messages

Previously, tool calls and tool call results would contain a matching `id` field to correlate tool call results with tool calls.

Here's an example trace taken a few days ago.
https://github.com/BloopAI/vibe-kanban/blob/fa7245c632ac774ec71a98e26094e0fb6d70cf14/crates/executors/tests/droid_snapshots/fixtures/edits-and-execution.jsonl#L3-L4

In v0.22.2, this `id` field is omitted from the tool result messages. Since tools can be called in parallel and thus tool result ordering isn't stable, it's h

[Issue] droid cli in a command prompt get's slower and slower over time

When using the droid cli on windows in a command prompt, the key response get's slower and slower overtime.

author: ryzen3100
content:
[Issue] Illegal instruction (core dumped)

I can't run Droid anymore, it used to work before, but with the latest update I'm getting core dumped error.
`Illegal instruction (core dumped)`
```
[vm@ubuntu-coding vm]> droid
fish: Job 1, 'droid' terminated by signal SIGILL (Illegal instruction)
```
Removing the `~/.factory/` directory and then reinstalling Droid didn't solve the issue.
System: Ubuntu VM on an Intel X5650 CPU host (Hyper-V).

author: byJim
content:
[Issue] Droid CLI crashes on CPUs without AVX2

Droid CLI v0.22.x crashes with `SIGILL` (Illegal Instruction) on CPUs that don't support AVX2. Older versions worked fine on the same hardware.

### Environment
- **OS:** Arch Linux
- **CPU:** Intel(R) Core(TM) i5-2400 CPU @ 3.10GHz
- **CPU Features:** AVX but **NO AVX2**
- **Droid Version:** 0.22.2

### Error
```
panic(main thread): Illegal instruction at address 0x3E8000018C1
Features: ... no_avx2 ...
oh no: Bun has crashed.
```

Bun v1.3.0 (embedded in Droid) requires AVX2, but my CPU only ha

author: accelas
content:
[Issue] Droid should not have file write permission outside project.

GLM 4.6 model have tendency to replace slash character in file path with underscore when it's nearly at max context window. eg `/home/user1/work/project` is changed to `/home/user1/work_project`.  This is observed for both z.ai's coding plan and droid-core model.

When droid is running under `/home/user1/work/project` , model may instruct droid to touch files under  `/home/user1/work_project`.

Regardless how model behave, the droid program itself should not give model permission to touch files

author: JohnDotOwl
content:
[Discussion] [Discussion] Droid Exec Headless Streaming with output format (JSON)

Droid Exec (Headless)
It make sense to use --output-format json if you're running a headless droid exec as that's the best way to programmatically manage the headless droid. The issue for me is i can't see the process and potentially stop it without --output-format debug and i can't run both output format. 

Should we consider having a different parameter for "streaming" , it's not so much for debugging but more to manage the task itself.

author: factory-ben
content:
[Discussion] Release v1.3.220

---

This release brings HTTP MCP server support, a `/compress` command to optimize your context usage and droid exec for CDE.

---

## HTTP MCP Server Support

Factory now supports streamable HTTP-based Model Context Protocol (MCP) servers in addition to stdio-based servers. This enables you to connect to MCP servers running as web services, making it easier to integrate with cloud-hosted tools and services.

When adding an MCP server, Factory automatically detects whether it's HTTP o

author: factory-ben
content:
[Discussion] CLI v0.16.0 Release Notes

- Sonnet 4.5 model is now available
- Clear chat input using double ESC or Ctrl-C
- User-configured allow and deny list of commands to execute
- Option to disable droid commit co-authoring
- Auth using FACTORY_API_KEY
- Fixed UI bugs due to resizing

author: factory-ben
content: [Discussion] #1 on Terminal Bench Read how we did it: https://factory.ai/news/terminal-bench

author: factory-ben
content:
[Discussion] CLI v0.7.0 Release Notes

CLI Release (0.7.0)

- Autonomy level selection: Users can now select any preferred autonomy level when confirming the ExitSpec tool
- Claude reasoning support: Added support for Claude's reasoning capabilities
- Session resumption: Users can now resume existing sessions when operating in Exec Mode
- Image reading capabilities: The CLI can now read and process images

content:

author: factory-ben
content:
[Discussion] CLI v0.5.0 Release Notes

v0.5 release:

- Users can now queue messages while the Droid works
- Added clearer autonomy level & mode descriptions
- Fixed many flickering issues
- Revamped `--help` command
- Automatic VSCode / Cursor / Windsurf CLI detection,
- Windows delete key bug fixed
- Lots of small UI improvements
- Lots of quality of life and bug fixes

coming soon:
- custom droids/subagents
- notif sounds
- much more

any requests?

author: fredrivett
content:
[Discussion] Hacked a lil hit counter for my site in a day w/ droid

The man @bentossell gave me access to droid last week, and I had the urge to add a retro hit counter to my site, so it was the perfect opportunity to test it out.

By the evening I'd gone back and forth on the tech, built it out and deployed it, with the widget live [on my site](https://www.fredrivett.com/).

It's live here: https://www.herenow.fyi/
And I've since split out the core code into this open source repo so anyone can set their own up: https://github.com/fredrivett/here-now

Fee
